content:
User: C:\ai-execution-system>where python C:\Program Files (x86)\Google\Cloud SDK\google-cloud-sdk\platform\bundledpython\python.exe C:\ai-execution-system>where pip INFO: Could not find files for the given pattern(s).

Gemini: Here's what I recommend you do:

Download the latest Python installer from python.org:

Go to https://www.python.org/downloads/windows/
Download the "Latest Python 3 Release" installer for Windows (usually a button that says something like "Download Python 3.x.x"). Choose the "Windows installer (64-bit)" if you have a 64-bit Windows system, which is most common these days.
Run the Python Installer:

Run the downloaded installer .exe file.
IMPORTANT: During the installation, make sure to check the box that says "Add Python x.x to PATH" (it's usually at the bottom of the first installation screen). This is crucial so that Python and pip are added to your system's PATH automatically.
You can usually accept the default installation options. Click "Install Now" or follow the prompts.
After installation completes, open a NEW command prompt.

Verify Python and pip are working from the new command prompt:

Type these commands and check the output:

python --version
pip --version
python --version: Should now show the version of the Python you just installed from python.org (not the Google Cloud SDK Python).
pip --version: Should now show the version of pip and should work without errors.
Please perform these steps to install Python from python.org, making sure to add Python to your PATH during installation. Then verify that both python --version and pip --version work in a new command prompt. Let me know once you've done this and what the output of those version commands is.

Once we have a working standard Python installation with pip, we can proceed to install git-filter-repo using pip install git-filter-repo and then finally remove those large files from your Git history! We are very close to resolving this!
